text: As lawmakers work out the different gas tax hikes in the transportation budgets they've passed, @GovMikeDeWine makes what could be his closing argument on his original 18 cent increase by driving home his concerns about safety:

text: Lots of big money for big projects in the state budget. Two members of the House Finance Committee - @RepJimButler and @jackbellaire - talk about it with me on @stateofohioshow. Watch it here:

text: I mispronounced Gallipolis in my first newscast at my first job on the radio station in my hometown of Lancaster (pronounced “LANK-is-ter”, BTW). My parents were embarrassed and co-workers demanded to know where I was raised.

text:
I'm from Lancaster and remember having to teach a radio station co-worker from upstate New York how to say it. She was baffled. 

Then I told her about Nerk.

text: ICYMI: Sen. @matthuffman1 is disappointed in the Medicaid expansion work requirements that Ohio got permission to implement on Friday. That plan exempts recipients over 50. Huffman says it should have been 55, and he wants to raise it to 65:
author: karenkasler

text: I’m just using the words “hike” and “increase” interchangeably. That’s all. We’ve done several stories and explanations about the context and have covered several times that the House took out the index to inflation.
author: karenkasler

text: Senate’s version of transportation budget being distributed - but chair @Rob_McColley makes it clear several times: they are “NOT accepting the House version’s tax package” and that the 10.7 increase will likely change - probably going lower
author: karenkasler

text: Transportation budget will be introduced in the Ohio Senate this morning with House’s 10.7 cent gas tax hike - down from @GovMikeDeWine’s proposed 18 cents. But there will be other changes to the bill, and the gas tax hike will likely also be changed this afternoon.
author: karenkasler

text: Happening shortly - bipartisan unveiling with @HouseholderOH and @EmiliaSykesOH. Householder had promised cameras in all committee rooms in his first remarks after being elected Speaker in January.

text: Senate version of Ohio transportation budget was expected today - now not till tomorrow. House version dropped Gov. Mike DeWine's initial gas tax hike from 18 cents to 10.7 cents. Senate version expected to go lower:

text: This region of Ohio really swings - watch the change from 1964-1972 and 1996-2004. The area has been all blue but never all red. However, Athens County has voted Republican, as recently as 1984.

text: How fun! It’s clear in some shots that the stadium is in Milwaukee (the call letters WTMJ are visible on the scoreboard several times - that’s the Milwaukee NBC affiliate). So it’s great that actual Cleveland fans were included.

text: Shots of the city are Cleveland, of course, but the stadium is in Milwaukee - right, @jknightwriter?

text: Ohio gets permission to impose work requirements on people in Medicaid expansion - more than 587,000, as of January:
author: karenkasler

text: Today was the deadline for @GovMikeDeWine’s first two-year budget. Here’s my coverage of the highlights, and @andy_chow’s report on how he’ll pay for them:
author: karenkasler

text: .@GovMikeDeWine had said he'd push for work requirements for those on Medicaid expansion during the campaign last year. Ohio Medicaid says 58 percent of the expansion population is working.
author: karenkasler

text: From Ohio Medicaid: federal government will allow Ohio to impose  work requirements on able-bodied Medicaid expansion recipients. They'll need to show they work 20 hours a week or are looking for work/are in job  training programs. Exemptions for people over 50 and caregivers.
author: karenkasler

text: CORRECTION - the proposed minimum age would increase, but the price per pack would not under DeWine's budget. The tax is already at that level.
author: karenkasler
